result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antiawn M Williams Jr

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. DPA Discharge Summary Report 10.19.2022

Defendant Antiawn M Williams Jr in court.  Attorney Helmi Hamad in court for Antiawn M Williams Jr.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court addressed the JusticePoint violation. Court offers defendant a verbal admonishment. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Violation Report 9.16.2022

Defendant Antiawn M Williams Jr in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defendant is compliant. Defendant on wait list for 'T4C'. Defendant completed community service. Court COMMENDS the defendant on his hard work. 
  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Review Hearing.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Amended DPA Supervision Report 7.22.2022
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 7.22.2022
Received and Filed. Community Service Time Sheet

Defendant Antiawn M Williams Jr in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
13 out of 16 office contacts made and 6 hours of community service has been completed. Defendant needs to attend treatment groups and complete community service hours to receive benefits of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 21.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 7.8.2022

Defendant Antiawn M Williams Jr (in person) in court with attorney Helmi Hamad (via Zoom).  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case in court to address violation. 
Defense provides update to the court. Arguments heard as to bail. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Court admonished the defendant. Case adjourned for Review Hearing in branch 21. Court vacates next court date.  Review hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:10 am.
Received and Filed, Staffing Report
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; DPA Violation Report 6.8.2022
Received and filed

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
 Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Antiawn M Williams Jr in court with attorney Helmi Hamad via zoom.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:40 am.
Received and Filed, Addendum to Plea Form
Received and Filed, Elements
Received and Filed., DPA Agreement
Received and Filed, Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Plea Advisement Form
Received and Filed, Prelim Waiver
